citations.narrative:
The animal inventory at the time of inspection was 440 chinchillas. This number exceeds the maximum number of 300
animals allowed under the current license.
The USDA license authorizes a specific number of animals to ensure that the facility and personnel possess adequate
facilities, employees and education to provide sufficient husbandry to the regulated animals. A licensee must obtain a new
license before any change resulting in more than the authorized number of animals on hand at any single point in time
during the period of licensure. The licensee must reapply for a license that properly reflects the number of regulated
animals under the license or reduce the number of regulated animals to a number which is under the maximum threshold
authorized under the current license.
To be corrected by December 6, 2023.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The licensee is administering expired Azithromycin Oral Suspension 200mg/5ml on single housed chinchilla (L86) that
had white, flaky, crust surrounding both closed eyes. The label of the oral antibiotic indicates it expired in October 2023.
Using expired drugs is not an appropriate method to prevent or treat injury or illness. The efficacy of these products
beyond their expiration date is uncertain. Use of these drugs could lead to failure to prevent or treat illness causing animal
harm and suffering.
To be corrected by end of business December 4, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
Kem Singletary, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.1(b)(2)(i) 
   
Requirements and application 
The animal inventory at the time of inspection was 440 chinchillas. This number exceeds the maximum number of 300 
animals allowed under the current license.  
 
The USDA license authorizes a specific number of animals to ensure that the facility and personnel possess adequate 
facilities, employees and education to provide sufficient husbandry to the regulated animals. A licensee must obtain a new 
license before any change resulting in more than the authorized number of animals on hand at any single point in time 
during the period of licensure. The licensee must reapply for a license that properly reflects the number of regulated 
animals under the license or reduce the number of regulated animals to a number which is under the maximum threshold 
authorized under the current license. 
 
To be corrected by December 6, 2023. 
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The licensee is administering expired Azithromycin Oral Suspension 200mg/5ml on single housed chinchilla (L86) that 
had white, flaky, crust surrounding both closed eyes. The label of the oral antibiotic indicates it expired in October 2023. 
Using expired drugs is not an appropriate method to prevent or treat injury or illness. The efficacy of these products 
beyond their expiration date is uncertain. Use of these drugs could lead to failure to prevent or treat illness causing animal 
harm and suffering. 
 
To be corrected by end of business December 4, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.

Additional Inspectors: 
Kem Singletary, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
